PIVOTAL FIELD OPERATIONS A Message from Greg Stroud AUGUST 2014 SALES NEWS FLASH Global Field Operations Team,
As we enter 2HFY14, please take the time to read the communication carefully; as there are a number of policy, process, and pricing changes that you should be aware of.
Deal Review Process Guide
NEW Deal Review Process Guide is now available on Inside Pivotal here <https://docs.google.com/a/pivotal.io/spreadsheets/d/16y1CSFZDoNCnQR0ljp7OgDX2-DFPufzpJvVEyBhsjxE/edit?usp=sharing>.
This document was designed to help guide you through the deal desk review process. There are resources embedded in this document that will either link you to a person or another document. The order of content is meant to reflect the steps necessary to walk you through each of the most important steps to successfully forecast, propose, cover Pivotal legally and booking the deal smoothly without any revenue recognition issues.
Field Sales Compensation Survey Results
Thank you to those who responded to the recent Field Sales Compensation survey sent earlier in August. Your opinions matter and we will be taking action. Over the next few weeks, we will share more details on specific plans to address your feedback as well as introducing you to a new sales compensation tool to be implemented for 2015. Look for more announcements on Inside Pivotal. Questions? Please send to Sales-Commissions@pivotal.io <mailto:Sales-Commissions@pivotal.io>.
VMware Specific Federation Engagement
In the 2nd half of 2014 our go-to-market with VMware has taken a solid step toward deeper alignment. Carl Eschenbach, VMware COO and Pivotal board member, committed to a shared goal of 30 Pivotal CF logos sold through VMware. In order to support the attainment of this goal, Pivotal and VMware are implementing a teaming process with the objective of bringing structure and clarity to our joint selling motion. Details for this were introduced in the Focus Account FAQ <https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B3CgGD1XdcmDNmxMbWdIb3g4d1k/edit?usp=sharing> sent in the call to action on 8/4. In summary, the process involves joint account planning on accounts where we are committing to collaborate, and then leveraging a 'teaming agreement <https://docs.google.com/a/pivotal.io/file/d/0B9FiuJ_zSTJrT0t0cGdzcVViWi1qQWpndE02WUt5RC1wWmtr/edit>', which is an account planning tool intended to identify and memorialize the activities that Pivotal and VMware teams will undertake as part of an agreed upon joint sales engagement plan. Below is the overall process you'll take with VMware field engagement. This will help to reduce concerns over committing time on joint opportunities and provide visibility to sales management.
- Account plan - Pivotal and VMware reps complete an initial account planning call to determine account fit and set timeline to jointly qualify opportunity - Qualify opportunity
- Teaming agreement - download agreement here <https://docs.google.com/a/pivotal.io/file/d/0B9FiuJ_zSTJrT0t0cGdzcVViWi1qQWpndE02WUt5RC1wWmtr/edit> - Document mutual steps to close in the teaming agreement with VMware counterpart
- Send to vmware-teaming@pivotal.io and copy both Pivotal and VMware sales managers - Approval - teaming agreements will be reviewed and approved on biweekly Regional Director cadence calls - Go close the deal
VMware Specific Compensation in 2H’14 From July 1st through December 31st all VMware Reps will need to follow a VMW registration process for PCF. There are no other changes to compensation for VMW reps.NEW Cloud Management Specialist/vCHS Specialist SPIF for Pivotal CFVMware is implementing a SPIF for Cloud Management Specialists and vCHS Specialists that will help drive the sale of Pivotal CF. More information on the VMware SPIF may be found here <https://docs.google.com/a/pivotal.io/file/d/0B9FiuJ_zSTJrM1hPVEcyVnhZMWc/edit> and VMware Sales Compensation for Pivotal products here <https://docs.google.com/a/pivotal.io/file/d/0B9FiuJ_zSTJrM0lEUXdTdkttSkk/edit>.Global Support Services Looking for a way to get 100% quota retiring credit for services and bring value to your customer that will result in additional sales? Contact the BCS team on how we can help you!BCS (Program Overview here <https://drive.google.com/a/pivotal.io/file/d/0B9FiuJ_zSTJrcVRmRjdwQnQ0cFltSGdyejRVTVlQTDhJTzdj/edit?usp=sharing>) has successfully engaged with multiple new strategic accounts, focused on supporting advanced technologies. These technologies include, Cloud Foundry, GemFire and Hadoop. For additional BCS information, please visit the BCS website <https://sites.google.com/a/pivotal.io/business-critical-support/home>.SFDC What’s NewPivotal Opportunity Product Selector is LIVE. Training slides and recordings have been posted on the SFDC home page under Salesforce Quick Tips. Thanks to everyone who helped with the requirements gathering and testing. Super user report training to be scheduled soon.Pivotal’s Reference System is LIVE. This month we launched Pivotal's reference system in SFDC, which enables you to easily find and share externally facing customer collateral with your prospects, receive feedback on what customers have clicked on, shared, and how they rated the content. You'll also be able to leverage a streamlined workflow to find accounts to take reference calls during the close process, with better information about how often that account has been engaged for reference activity. Use The Tool, Win Prizes! Prizes for the fulfillment of reference activity include an iPad Air, Bose headphones, rolex watches and much more. Learn about the tool with this 15-minute self-paced training <https://sites.google.com/a/pivotal.io/customer-marketing-and-programs/references/reference-system>. Make it happen!Greg
